word_mean: 药衡制质量(重量)单位，1英分为1.296克，缩写为scr.

sentence.Network_en: He acted wrongly and without scruple.
The villain made no scruple of committing murder.
He did not scruple to talk crudely either.
sentence.Network_cn: 年青人毫无拘束的还加上许多粗话蠢话.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 另一位则是作家克兰茨（Judith Krantz），她大胆露骨的言情小说《顾虑》（Scruples）成为一九七八年时的榜首，那时她正好五十岁 …
打兰(apoth dram)、 英分(scruple)、格令(grain)等组成药衡单位系列。其换算率为: 1 药衡磅= 12 药衡盎司;1 药衡盎司= 8 打兰;1 打兰= 3 英分;1.
...scrunch 碾碎；咬碎；缩紧；使弯曲；蜷缩scruple 迟疑；顾虑scrutiny program 检查程序
人的本能把焦虑的痛苦缩小成恐惧症，同样的，罪恶感也会被人约束成所谓心理顾忌（Scruples）。英文scruples是从拉丁文Scrupulu…

list.abs: To deaden , as to feelings or moral scruples ;, 使麻木不仁如使感情或道德良知麻木;
成熟老练的：mellow肆无忌惮：without scruple(不懂放手，皆为困兽。)
all crooked scruples vanish , let me hopelessly lose my way ., 让扭曲的顾虑消亡吧 , 让我绝望地迷路吧.
SHe has no scruples ; she will do whatever she want to ., 她是一个毫无顾忌的人 ; 她想要做什麽就做什麽.
SHe has no scruples ; she will do whatever she want to ., 她是一个毫无顾忌的人 ; 她想要做什麽就做什麽.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from French scrupule or Latin scrupulus, from scrupus, literally 'rough pebble', (figuratively) 'anxiety'

entry.tran: (道德上的)顾忌,顾虑;良心不安
entry.def: Scruples are moral principles or beliefs that make you unwilling to do something that seems wrong.

means.word_mean: 1. a unit of apothecary weight equal to 20 grains
2. uneasiness about the fitness of an action
3. an ethical or moral principle that inhibits action

sentences.sentence: "He lied and did not even scruple about it"

auth_sentence.content: Let no man scruple my honourable mention of this noble enemy.
auth_sentence.res_content: Let no man scruple my honourable mention of this noble enemy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Let no man scruple my honourable mention of this noble enemy.

auth_sentence.content: Critics...will weigh me out, scruple by scruple, their judicial verdicts.
auth_sentence.res_content: Critics...will weigh me out, scruple by scruple, their judicial verdicts.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Critics...will weigh me out, scruple by scruple, their judicial verdicts.

auth_sentence.content: Obsessed with preparedness, they sometimes did not scruple about overstating the threat for which preparation was necessary.
auth_sentence.res_content: Obsessed with preparedness, they sometimes did not scruple about overstating the threat for which preparation was necessary.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Obsessed with preparedness, they sometimes did not scruple about overstating the threat for which preparation was necessary.

sentences.en: He acted wrongly and without scruple.
The villain made no scruple of committing murder.
A man who could make so vile a pun would not scruple to pick a pocket.
sentences.cn: 一个能说出如此恶劣双关语的人，是不会对偷窃钱包感到不安的。
